messages.title: Labour Invest in Education
messages.content: Ann Clwyd congratulated the Welsh Assembly on recent investments made in Cynon Valley schools. New Abercynon Primary School and Aberdare Community School are testament to Labour's commitment to education.

messages.title: Small Business Under Attack
messages.content: Small, innovative businesses are under attack in the valleys. Cuts from Tory-controlled Westminster and the failure to guarantee access to the our biggest single market after Brexit could put new and vulnerable businesses out of operation for good.

messages.title: More Police on the Beat with Labour
messages.content: Ann Clwyd welcomed Labour's commitment to extra police officers, which will provide visible, proactive patrols in Cynon Valley.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Investment in local schools such as new Abercynon Primary School and Aberdare Community School.
Opposition to Tory cuts and the importance of ensuring access to the single market after Brexit for small businesses.
Ann Clwyd supports Labour's commitment to increasing the number of police officers.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Warning of a possible Conservative landslide and reflections on Thatcher's legacy.

issues.education: Ann Clwyd congratulated the Welsh Assembly on recent investments in Cynon Valley schools.

politicalExperience.role: MP for the Cynon Valley for 33 years
politicalExperience.achievements: Former Shadow Secretary of State for International Development, Former Welsh and Culture, Media and Sport. Former Chair Parliamentary Labour Party.

contactInformation.address: 1 Oak Street, Aberdare, Rhondda Cynon Taf, CF44 7AP

images.caption: Ann Clwyd and Jeremy Corbyn in Aberdare.
Abercynon School example of Labour investment.
